definition: variant of 喧[xuan1]/old variant of 諼|谖[xuan1]

sentences.english: I love to meet up with my friends, get out of the city.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢和朋友们聚在一起，离开城市的喧嚣。

sentences.english: The"Madding Crowd"conceals the deep sense of illusion and absurdity.
sentences.chinese: 热闹喧嚣的场面下，蕴涵着浓重的虚幻感和荒诞意识。

sentences.english: True happiness is of a retired nature, and enemy to pomp and noise.
sentences.chinese: 真正的幸福不显山露水，它摈弃浮华和喧嚣。

sentences.english: Would you like to get away from the noisy city for a short while?
sentences.chinese: 你想不想暂离这个喧嚣的城市？

sentences.english: This crowd who could hide and, once again, eat you.
sentences.chinese: 这喧嚣谁能躲得及，再一次，侵蚀你。

sentences.english: It's like chaos, loud, and people were playing music.
sentences.chinese: 一片混乱，喧嚣，还有人播放音乐。

sentences.english: The noise of the street kept me awake in the night.
sentences.chinese: 街上的喧嚣声让我彻夜难眠。

sentences.english: On this tumultuous descent, streams merge and tributaries unite.
sentences.chinese: 喧嚣下，百川并纳，支流汇合。

sentences.english: It is late afternoon now. After a busy day.
sentences.chinese: 喧嚣一天过后，傍晚的包河静如图画。

sentences.english: Away from the madding crowd, dust , smoke and din.
sentences.chinese: 远离发狂的群众，灰尘，烟和喧嚣。

sentences.english: Such a talk created quite a stir.
sentences.chinese: 诸如此类的论调喧嚣一时。

sentences.english: Will China be able to embrace the hurly burly of the entrepreneurial marketplace?
sentences.chinese: 中国真得能够接受创业者市场的喧嚣与强大？

sentences.english: Noise does not rouse a drunken man; silence awakens him.
sentences.chinese: 喧嚣不曾吵醒一个醉汉。

sentences.english: In the hustle and bustle of day, thoughts constantly Pianfei, has some of the Juan.
sentences.chinese: 在喧嚣的白日里，思绪在不断地翩飞，已有些倦了。

sentences.english: It must not be based on "uproarious Western music".
sentences.chinese: 绝不允许以喧嚣的西方音乐为基础。

sentences.english: I don't see the hustle and bustle like where you were brought up, Harp.
sentences.chinese: 哈普，我看在那里就没你长大的地方那么喧嚣和骚乱。

definition: lanterns red, wine green (idiom); feasting and pleasure-seeking/debauched and corrupt environment
endless stream of horse and carriages (idiom)/heavy traffic
